```{r}
#| include: false

#### Load Library ####
library(tidyverse)
library(ggplot2)
library(RColorBrewer)
library(modelsummary)
library(kableExtra)
library(knitr)

#### Import cleaned_gss_2021.csv ####
cleaned_gss_2021 <-
  read.csv(here::here("./inputs/data/2021_data/cleaned_gss_2021.csv"))

```

```{r}
#| include: false

#### Create Variable Description Tibble #### 

 variable_table <-
  tibble(
    "Variable" = c(
      "class",
      "degree",
      "finrela",
      "happy",
      "satjob",
      "satfin",
      "sex"
    ),
    "Variable Description" = c(
      "Self-ascribed class of the respondent",
      "Highest level of education achieved by respondent",
      "Self-ascribed ranking of respondnet when compared to other US households",
      "Respondent's rating of how happy they are daily",
      "Level of satisfaction with the work respondents do",
      "Level of satisfaction with the job respondents have",
      "Sex of the respondent"
    )
  )
```

```{r}
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
#| label: tbl-1
#| tbl-cap: "Variable Descriptions"

#### Add Variable Table ####
variable_table |>
  kable(booktabs = TRUE) |>
  kable_styling(font_size = 7, latex_options = "hold_position")

```

```{r}
#| include: false

#### Ordering ####

cleaned_gss_2021$degree <- 
  factor(cleaned_gss_2021$degree, 
         levels = c("Less Than High School", "High School", "Associate / Junior College", "Bachelors Degree", "Graduate Degree"))

```

```{r}
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
#| label: fig-2
#| fig-cap: "Respondent's Sex by Highest Level of Education"

#### Creating Graph to Compare Sex Against Level of Education ####

cleaned_gss_2021 |>
  ggplot(mapping = aes(x = sex, fill = degree)) +
  geom_bar() + 
  theme_classic() +
  labs(x = "Sex",
       y = "Number",
       fill = "Degree")+
  scale_fill_brewer(palette = "Pastel1")

```

```{r}
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
#| label: fig-3
#| fig-cap: "Respondent's Sex by Highest Level of Education"

#### Creating Graph to Compare Sex Against Level of Education ####

cleaned_gss_2021 |>
  ggplot(mapping = aes(x = sex, fill = richwork)) +
  geom_bar() + 
  theme_classic() +
  labs(x = "Sex",
       y = "Number",
       fill = "Rich Work")+
  scale_fill_brewer(palette = "Pastel1")
```

```{r}
#### Ordering ####
```


```{r}
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
#| label: fig-5
#| fig-cap: "Respondent's Sex by Self-Defined Financial Ranking Against Other US Families"

#### Creating Graph to Compare Sex Against Self-Defined Financial Ranking Against Other US Families ####

cleaned_gss_2021 |>
  ggplot(mapping = aes(x = sex, fill = finrela)) +
  geom_bar() + 
  theme_classic() +
  labs(x = "Sex",
       y = "Number",
       fill = "Rating Against Other Families")+
  scale_fill_brewer(palette = "Pastel1")
```

```{r}
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
#| label: fig-6
#| fig-cap: "Respondent's Highest Level of Education by Self-Defined Financial Ranking Against Other US Families"

#### Creating Graph to Compare Sex Against Self-Defined Financial Ranking Against Other US Families ####

cleaned_gss_2021 |>
  ggplot(mapping = aes(y = degree, fill = finrela)) +
  geom_bar() + 
  theme_classic() +
  labs(y = "Highest Level of Education",
       x = "Number",
       fill = "Rating Against Other Families")+
  scale_fill_brewer(palette = "Pastel1")+
  theme(legend.title = element_text(size = 6),
        legend.text= element_text(size=6))
```
